info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Cameron, or 13 miles west of Waynesburg, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Washington, Wolfdale, East Washington, West Finley, Claysville, Eighty Four, Aleppo, Taylorstown, Amity, Nineveh, and Green Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 5 and 27. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 24 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
